body: The JDK change requires opt-in, could you test running with `--host_jvm_args=-XX:+UseAllWindowsProcessorGroups`?

I get:

`startup --host_jvm_args=-XX:+UseAllWindowsProcessorGroups`

```
Unrecognized VM option 'UseAllWindowsProcessorGroups'
Error: Could not create the Java Virtual Machine.
Error: A fatal exception has occurred. Program will exit.
```

Is bazel using the version of JDK that has this backport?

As it turns out it's not: https://github.com/openjdk/jdk21u-dev/commit/c8b8f72aeffa8a93c4b848679f4eb9bd43ee2a86
21.0.6 isn't even out yet from Oracle or Azul. We'll have to wait for that.

It looks like 21.0.6 will be out on 21st Jan (next Tuesday): https://wiki.openjdk.org/display/JDKUpdates/JDK+21u

Is updating to this part of the standard Bazel process or will it need to be a special activity?

Thanks
It's not part of the process, but I'll snooze this for Tuesday. Feel free to ping me in case I forget.
Nvm, Bazel is already on JDK 23 at HEAD, which includes this change.

@peakschris Could you test the latest commit from the `release-8.1.0` branch after https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/pull/25014 has been merged? If you can enable the flag via `--host_jvm_args` there, you could submit a PR adding it somewhere [here](https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/blob/47dde3741bde5b499c39d96e9ad0941bde864288/src/main/cpp/blaze.cc#L377).

release-8.1.0 head, and `startup --host_jvm_args=-XX:+UseAllWindowsProcessorGroups`, is working!

Bazel is using all our 96 virtual processors :-)

Thank you

issue.title: See and use more than 64 CPUs on Windows

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

body:
Thank you @fmeum for helping out here!

One thought I had while skimming this issue: If `XX:+UseAllWindowsProcessorGroup` didn't exist, we could work around the issue by setting `-XX:ActiveProcessorCount=96`.

issue.title: [8.1.0] See and use more than 64 CPUs on Windows

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

Closes #25087.

body:
A fix for this issue has been included in [Bazel 8.1.0 RC1](https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/releases/tag/8.1.0rc1). Please test out the release candidate and report any issues as soon as possible.
If you're using Bazelisk, you can point to the latest RC by setting USE_BAZEL_VERSION=8.1.0rc1. Thanks!
